CHIEF COMPLAINT: LEFT LOW BACKAND LEG PAIN.

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Ms. Myers saw Dr. Steven Brown last week. He put her on sedentaw
duty.

Ms. Myers is one of our patients who last month developed pain in the left low back and hip into the groin and
lateral thigh, numbness and tingling in her foot. Pain especially hurts sitting and lying down, 6/10 to 10/10 on
the pain scale. She has failed to respond to a steroid pack. She has taken ibuprofen and had pain
management.

PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:

General: Alert and oriented X3.

Cardiovascular: No lower extremity edema. Has 2+ dorsal pedal pulse.

Neurological Exam: Straight leg raise is negative. No clonus elicited. Sensation is intact. Patellar reflexes
and Achilles reflexes are symmetrical. Reverse straight leg raise is positive on the left.

Musouloskeletal: Strength in the lower extremities is 5/5 throughout. Facet loading is negative. Modified
Stinchfield test is negative. Positive tenderness to palpation is noted severely in the left L4 and L5 facet joint
area and sciatic notch and greater troohanter. FABER test causes pain in the left low back and lateral hip. No
pain in the groin. Negative Stinchfield maneuver.

IMAGING: Six views today show no compression fractures, no pars defects, no instability. Disc spaces are
well maintained. AP views of the lumbar spine from this week show 5 lumbarized vertebral bodies. No lateral
listhesis. No lateral osteophytes. SI joints look okay.

PLAN: We are going to place her on ibuprofen 800, give her some Robaxin, re-up her hydrocodone 7.5 and
put her into lumbar radiculopathy physical therapy with some traction, and will get an injection scheduled for a
left greater trochanteric bursa injection with ultrasound guidance. We will keep her on desk work activity only
until I see her for followup in 6 weeks.

Electronically signed by John D. Dookenj, MD
